What Is Apostille?

An Apostille is a special certificate issued by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) in India. It is attached to your document to confirm that it is authentic and verified by the correct authorities.
When your document gets an Apostille stamp, it becomes valid and acceptable in all Hague Convention countries (more than 120 countries like the USA, UK, France, Germany, Australia, and others).

For example, if you are going to work in France or study in Germany, your degree or personal certificates must first get an Apostille from MEA. With Pro Attestation, this process becomes simple and secure, as our team takes care of everything — from verification to final delivery.
Why Is Apostille Needed?
Apostille is an essential step for anyone going abroad for work, study, or family reasons. It proves that your documents are original and can be trusted by foreign authorities.
Here are some common reasons why Apostille is required:

items:
To study abroad (for degrees, diplomas, or mark sheets)
To work overseas (for employment documents or experience certificates)
To apply for family or dependent visas (for marriage or birth certificates)
To start a business abroad (for commercial or company papers)
